info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 8:13PM CDT until June 07 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/ FOR WALLACE...SOUTHWESTERN THOMAS...WESTERN LOGAN AND SOUTHEASTERN SHERMAN COUNTIES... At 712 PM MDT/812 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 40 mph. An additional severe storm was located in southeastern Sherman County. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 712 PM MDT...two inch diameter hail was reported in Sharon Springs. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Wallace, southwestern Thomas, western Logan and southeastern Sherman Counties. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 15 and 18. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
